questions.questionText: What is the simple interest on Rs. 5000 for 2 years at the rate of 10% per annum?
Find the simple interest on Rs. 8000 for 6 months at 12% per annum.
questions.explanation: First convert time to years: 6 months = 6 ÷ 12 = 0.5 years. SI = (P × R × T) ÷ 100 = (8000 × 12 × 0.5) ÷ 100 = 48000 ÷ 100 = Rs. 480.

questions.questionText: At what rate percent per annum will a sum of money double itself in 8 years?
questions.explanation: For doubling, R × T = 100. Given T = 8 years, so R = 100 ÷ 8 = 12.5% per annum.

questions.questionText: A sum of Rs. 10,000 is invested in two parts, one at 8% and the other at 10% per annum simple interest. If the total interest after 1 year is Rs. 920, how much was invested at 10%?
